DataElement.preferredName: Person Receive Bevacizumab Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the receipt of bevacizumab as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Receive Bevacizumab Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._To take, accept, or get something offered._A drug used to treat several types of cancer, including certain types of colorectal, lung, breast, and kidney cancers and glioblastoma. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer. Avastin binds to vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and may prevent the growth of new blood vessels that tumors need to grow. It is a type of antiangiogenesis agent and a type of monoclonal antibody._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Receive Bevacizumab Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:A drug used to treat several types of cancer, including certain types of colorectal, lung, breast, and kidney cancers and glioblastoma. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer. Avastin binds to vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and may prevent the growth of new blood vessels that tumors need to grow. It is a type of antiangiogenesis agent and a type of monoclonal antibody.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.

A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Will the patient receive beva
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient receive bevacizumab to support additional radiation therapy or immunotherapy, or primarily for the reduction of edema rather than for tumor treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient receive bevacizumab primarily for reduction of edema (i.e. alleviation of symptoms) rather than for tumor treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient receive bevacizumab or its biosimilars primarily for reduction of edema (i.e. alleviation of symptoms) rather than for tumor treatment?

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
